revised_title: Circulation and fronts in continental shelf seas: Slope turbulence, internal waves, and phytoplankton growth at the Celtic Sea shelf-break
tldr: This article explores the circulation and fronts in continental shelf seas, focusing on the Celtic Sea shelf-break. It discusses the role of slope turbulence, internal waves, and mixing processes in influencing phytoplankton growth. The study reveals that increased mixing at the shelf-break leads to a wider separation of isopycnals, resulting in a more favorable environment for phytoplankton growth due to the release of nutrients and light energy.
